projectDescription: The goal is to move from static planning to an active, digital decision-support engine. This platform will empower North Carolina county leaders to transform complex opioid settlement data into actionable, research-backed funding strategies.
internalNotes: Client referred by UNC. Budget is grant-funded so timeline flexibility is good. Key deadline is March 31 pilot.

phases.name: Brand Identity & Technical Discovery
phases.description: Development of a standalone visual identity distinct from existing branding. Ingest research-validated Excel formulas to map JavaScript logic.

phases.name: Technical Architecture & Infrastructure
phases.description: Establishment of the secure database and authentication system. Wireframing of the dashboard and overarching site structure.

phases.name: Pilot App Development
phases.description: Development of the core functionality for the pilot deadline. Focus on the functional logic of the 5-step path.

phases.name: High-Fidelity Refinement & Reporting
phases.description: Refinement of UI/UX based on beta testing. Build dynamic reporting engine and implement project forking logic.

phases.name: Launch & Optimization
phases.description: Rollout of CMS and admin portal, followed by dedicated support for optimizing user flow and bug fixes.
